The z direction in this PT system is infinitely long, and the acoustic waves propagate along the x direction. Throughout this paper, the finite-element method (FEM) based on the software COMSOL Multiphysics 5.3a is employed for the simulations. The calculations of the band structure are performed with the super cell method. For Fig. 3(a), the background pressure field of plane waves is used, and periodic boundary conditions are imposed to the upper and lower boundaries to simplify the structure and reduce the amount of calculation without losing accuracy. Each strip of the pressure pattern in Fig. 6(b) is independently calculated. Perfectly matched layers (PMLs) are also used in Fig. 7(c) to eliminate the reflected waves by the outer boundaries.
